location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

physicalDescription.extent: Dimensions:199 x 294 mmCondition:The image is in good condition though punctured partially four times along the lower edge and twice completely by a hole punching device, also along the lower edge.Foliation:‘157’Process:Silver gelatin print

mods.abstract: Genre/Subject Matter:This photograph shows a road through Shaikh Aḥmad's estates at Fao, and the date gardens affected by the Basra port authorities’ widening of the roads.The road extends from foreground to background at right, with date palms on either side.Inscriptions:Recto, upper left, in pen: ‘157’Verso, upper left, in pen: ‘HOWZ AL-BANGALOW FAO’Lower left, ink stamp: ‘DOMNICK PHOTO BASRAH’
